publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4074 Aileen Campbell: Restoration of Falls of Clyde Mural—That the Parliament congratulates artist and writer Alasdair Gray on completing the restoration of his Falls of Clyde mural in the Riverside Bar near New Lanark; notes that the mural, over 25ft in length, was originally painted over 40 years ago when the bar was known as the Kirkfieldbank Tavern; further congratulates bar owner Andy Boyle on his decision to commission Alasdair Gray to undertake the restoration, and hopes that the mural will encourage many more people from across Scotland to visit rural South Lanarkshire, including the Falls of Clyde, the New Lanark World Heritage Site and local establishments such as the Riverside Bar. Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Brian Adam*, Marlyn Glen*, Kenneth Gibson*, Sandra White*, Alasdair Allan*, Elaine Smith*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Kidd*, Bob Doris*, Christina McKelvie*, Stewart Maxwell*
S3M-4074 Restoration of Falls of Clyde Mural (lodged on 6 May 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Robin Harper*, Anne McLaughlin*
